thread.title: The Best Austin Pop-Up Restaurants To Put On Your Radar
thread.title_full: The Best Austin Pop-Up Restaurants To Put On Your Radar

author: Nadia Chaudhury
title: The Best Austin Pop-Up Restaurants To Put On Your Radar
text:
[Photo: Play Dough/Facebook ] 
Details: Pastry chef Janina O’Leary loves doughnuts so much, she started a pop-up series just for the sweet treat. The most recent one took over Franklin Barbecue with with brioche doughnuts (fried in Franklin's beef tallow) filled with bourbon banana cream and topped with Franklin brisket-infused chocolate glaze, and more sweet goods. The last one had a holiday-bent , with pumpkin pop tarts, matcha doughnuts, and everything milk bread rolls. Date: TBA Price: Varies per baked good. Already happened Bagel Pop-Up 
Details: Former Bufalina and Josephine House chef Alex Manley is bringing her wood-fired bagels to Olamaie for a perfect morning pop-up. This time, she’s bringing fish smoked by barbecue mastermind Aaron Franklin himself, which will pair nicely with brunch cocktails and Figure 8 coffee. Date: Sunday, January 22, 110 a.m. to 2 p.m. Price: Varies Emily & Emmy Squared 
Details: One of New York’s best burgers, from Emily, and chicken sandwiches, from sibling restaurant Emmy Squared, are popping up in Austin courtesy of Cane Rosso. The pizzeria warns that there are very limited amount of each dish available (only 50 to 60 each), so get there early. Dates: Tuesday, January 10, 5 p.m. Where: Cane Rosso, Sunset Valley Price: The burger is $15, the chicken sandwich is $15. De La Terre 
Details: Austin chefs Lori Bergeron (who worked at Uchi, 24 Diner, and Fixe) and Anthony Nicaj started their own pop-up dinner series . The menu ranges from eight to twelve courses, spanning dishes with seasonal and foraged ingredients, like like cold carrot tom kha. It returns this year in a new location. Date: Sunday, January 15, 7 to 9 p.m. Price: Tickets $120 with pairings, $100 without. Confituras Bake Sale 
Details: Newly-anointed Confituras pastry chef Kendall Melton is showcasing her baking prowess with a baking pop-up with brioche, cookies, pies, danishes, and much more, plus those jams, at the gelato shop. Date: Saturday, November 19, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Where: Gelateria Gemelli, East Sixth Price: Varies per baked good. Victoria Provisions 
Details: Former Geraldine’s chef Jesse DeLeon started his own dinner series focusing on Southern Texas coastal fare with Victoria Provisions. The fall menu includes with poached flounder, ricotta gnudi and fry pie Dates: Thursdays and Fridays, with seatings starting at 7 p.m. Where: Patricia’s Table, 1510 W 35th Street Price: $65. No Vacancy – A Prohibition Roadhouse 
Details: Catering company Catering With a Twist is now getting into the pop-up dinner game, offering a new theme for each dinner (August’s was steampunk). Executive chef Lexy Hasley and her team will take each proposed theme, creating a related menu. Date: Wednesday, November 9 Where: Trinity Hall, 311 East 5th Street Price: Tickets are $65. Ashley Christensen 
Details: Raleigh chef (of most notable, Poole's Diner) and cookbook author Ashley Christensen is teaming up with Olamaie’s Michael Fojtasek for a collaborative dinner featuring wth dishes from her book, like crab churros. Date: Monday, November 7, 5:30 to 8:30 p.m. Price: Tickets , which include a copy of the cookbook, are $125 Fat Rice 
Details: Josephine House is hosting Fat Rice chefs and cookbook authors Abe Conlon and Adrienne Lo for a five-course meal with lacassà noodle soup and almond gelee Date: Saturday, November 6, with seatings from 6 to 10 p.m. Where: Josephine House, Clarksville Price: Reservations are $55 per person, $85 per person with wine pairings Riley Chandler's Pop-Up Tour 
Details: Arizona chef Riley Chandler highlights his roots with a nationwide pop-up tour , which includes a stop in Austin. With guest chef James Piazza at his side, the pair will cook up Southwestern dishes like chile verde catfish, lobster gumbo, and lamb mole. Chandler studied under James Beard Award winner Janos Wilder, and currents works in The Carriage House. Dates: Saturday, October 29, 6 p.m. Where: To be announced to ticketholders. Price: Reservations are $100 or $125. Patika’s Paperboy Pop-up 
Details: The South Lamar coffee shop will dole out pastries during the breakfast trailer’s brunch service on Saturday. This means scones (whiskey maple bacon, blood orange poppyseed, and chocolate cherry), plus sweet breakfast cakes (sage plum, fig jam and walnut), cinnamon rolls, carrot cake oatmeal creme pie, and brown butter cookie with cookie chunks and spiced pepitas. Date: Saturday, October 15, from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. or until sold out Price: $2.50 to $6. Department of Donuts Pop-Up and Brunch 
Details: The South First restaurant is hosting Washington, D.C.-based pastry chef Naomi Gallego of the aptly-named Department of Donuts for a doughnut-filled weekend in October. There will be $2 cake doughnuts, $3 brioche, and more brunch food and drink. Dates: Saturday and Sunday, October 15 and 16, 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. Price: Varies per item. Moneycat Dinner 
Details: Houston chef Justin Yu is taking over Josephine House for a dinner with Justin Vann of Public Serves Wine & Whiskey. The four-course dinner includes sticky rice and sesame tamales, and flounder sashimi. Date: Sunday, October 9, with seatings from 6 to 9:30 p.m. Where: Josephine House, Clarksville Price: Reservations are $50 per person, $85 per person with wine pairings Pizzeria Sorellina 
Details: For a preview of Apis’ pizzeria, head to Pizzeria Sorellina’s pop-up at fellow pizza spot Bufalina, with pies like verde with smoked kale and ramp pesto, Manilla clam, and wild boar salumi in several styles. Dates: Monday, September 26, from 6 to 9 p.m. Price: Varies per dish. Barley-Que 
Details: Bryce Gilmore is venturing into barbecue territory with an smoked meats pop-up. His takes could potentially include beef tongue, goat shoulder, and smoked quail. What’s even better is that everything is all-you-can-eat, so prepare to gorge, and nope, you can’t make reservations, so expect lines. Dates: Sunday, September 11, 5 to 10 p.m. or until sold out. Where: Barley Swine, Brentwood Price: $45 per person. Josephine House 
Details: The bungalow restaurant will host two renown out-of-town chefs in the coming months for two dinners. The first is with chef Joshua McFadden of Eater Portland 38 Italian restaurant Ava Gene’s in April. Then chef Renee Erickson, known for Eater Seattle 38 The Walrus and the Carpenter, along with The Whale Wins, heads into town later this summer. Dates: Sunday, April 3, 6 to 10 p.m. (McFadden); Sunday, June 12, 6 to 10 p.m. (Erickson) Where: Josephine House, Clarksville Price: $65 ticket for McFadden; Erickson isn’t on sale yet. Ice Cream Social Supper 
Details: Texas Indian food and ice cream will go great together with Anjore and Spun Ice Cream's pop-up dinner. The four courses will center around duck, vegetables, nitrogen-cooled ice cream, and whiskey cocktails, plus guests can BYOB. The menu includes a duck thali and lemongrass/coriander/makrut/lime leaf ice cream topped with duck skin tuile. Dates: Thursday, June 16, 6 to 9 p.m. Where: Black Lagoon, 4301 Guadalupe Street Price: $75 . Tito's, Blackbird Bakery, and Barlata's Gluten-Free Dinners 
Details: Blackbird Bakery is teaming up with tapas restaurant Barlata and Tito’s Vodka for special gluten-free dishes and drinks. There will be five different tapas and two desserts paired with three special cocktails. There are plans to hold future dinners, too. Dates: Thursday, May 26, with more to be announced Price: Tickets are $80. Bufalina’s BAGEL Brunch Pop-Up 
Details: The Neapolitan pizza spot tests potential brunch waters with a bagel pop-up, with all the appropriate accompaniments, plus smoked fish and white fish salad from Jeffrey’s/Josephine House chef Rebecca Meeker, morning drinks, and Figure 8 coffee. Date: Sunday, May 22, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Price: Varies per item. Pranom Pop-Up 
Details: The roaming Los Angeles-based Thai pop-up ’s scheduled Austin stops this year include weekly Friday lunches held at Hops & Grain. Then there are Tuesday nights at Infinite Monkey Theorem from 5 to 9 p.m.; Wednesday nights at The Local from 7 to 11 p.m.; and Thursday lunch at Dominican Joe's from 11:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Previous menus featured Burmese-Thai curry and vegetable drunken noodles. Dates: Check the Facebook page Where: Hops & Grain, East Side , Infinite Monkey Theorem, South Congress , The Local, 2610 Guadalupe, and Dominican Joe’s, 515 South Congress Avenue Price: Varies per dish. Coast 
Details: After stints at Container Bar and a Prelog’s dinner, Coast, the seafood-focused restaurant replacing downtown wine bar Mulberry, is taking up at Parlor and Yard starting tomorrow for approximately two to four weeks. Tacos like OG with beer-battered fish with Guajillo corn puree, and the Luau full of Kahlua pig and smoked pineapple and corn relish, plus sides like papas bravas, will be served. Look out for more dinners in the future. Dates: Starting Wednesday, March 30, 5 to 10 p.m., Tuesday through Saturday Where: Parlor and Yard, West Sixth Price: $5 tacos, $4 sides. Roots to Leaves Supper Club 
Details: The renamed supper club (formerly Hyde Park Supper Club) is taking over Fork & Vine for two nights for a vegan feast. Dishes include a charcuterie board with vegan takes on pates, oyster mushroom cakes, braised tempeh, and cultured cashew cheesecake. Most dishes are or can be made gluten-free. Drink up vegan craft beers, too. Date: Sunday, April 3 through Monday, April 4, seatings from 5:30 to 8:30 p.m. Price: Varies per item, reservations are recommended . Juniper’s Pastry Dinner 
Juniper will host a whole bunch of pastry chefs for a sweet and savory 14 course dinner. On deck are Juniper’s Kerstin Bellah, Zach Hunter from Fixe, Susana Querejazu of Odd Duck/Barley Swine, Philip Speer, and Brian Mercury from Harvest in Cambridge, Massachusetts. Dates: Monday, February 29, 7 p.m.. Where: Juniper, East Cesar Chavez Price: Tickets are $65, with an additional $25 for cocktail pairings. Scrumptious Chef 
Details: Scrumptious Chef is taking over Tamale House East's kitchen with Saint Arnold Brewing Company for a New Orleans Creole dinner. Dishes will include gumbo, chicken clemenceau, shrimp fondue, and praline pudding. Pre-dinner cocktails includes requisite sazeracs, daiquiris, and other drinks. Dates: Saturday, February 27, 6 to 10 p.m. Price: Varies per dishes and drinks . Roberta’s at Bufalina 
Details: The famed Brooklyn pizzeria’s invasion of Bufalina is still underway , with New York-Neapolitan hybrid pies full of Franklin Barbecue brisket, honey, EVOO, and so much mozzarella. Dates: Today until Thursday, January 28, 11:30 a.m. to 11:30 p.m. daily Price: Varies from $11 to $19. Kaki Lima 
Details: The Boston Indonesian street food pop-up is making its way to Austin, armed with Southeast Asian fusion fare, for a special Texas-influenced dinner. Look out for signature dishes like slow-cooked beef, pandan crepes, and charred eggplants. Dates: Thursday, February 4, 7 p.m. Price: $70 for dinner, $50 for wine pairings. Monkey Town 6 
Details: The immersive video dinner experience is still going strong after opening last November . Guests enjoy a five course dinner prepared by Sonya Cote while sitting inside of a four-screen cube with a two-hour-long video installation. As seatings wind down, three special dinners have been added: one prepared by San Antonio's Josh Cross, a Lunar New Year-themed meal, and a BYO food Mardi Gras party. Dates: Until Tuesday, February 9 Where: 2416 East 6th Street Price: Tickets range from $25 to $80. Canceled Good Sounds, Tastes Good 
Details: Marc Vetri calls on celebrity chefs Jonathan Waxman and Aaron Sanchez, along with Austin’s Drew Curren, and other Pizzeria Vetri chefs, for a special five-course pizza dinner held right in Space 24 Twenty’s courtyard. Plus, Vetri and Phil Roy are playing music, too. The menu includes a Gulf shrimp aguachile, avocado, tomatillo, serrano pizza from Sanchez, Jonathan Waxman’s chicken with salsa verde, and more. Since Austin Food and Wine Festival is canceled this weekend, which means many out-of-town chefs aren’t coming into Austin, Vetri and executive chef Jeff Michaud will be whipping up custom pizza pies of their choosing for guests to purchase in the evening. Dates: Thursday, April 21, 6:00 p.m. Where: Space 24 Twenty, Campus Price: $125 per person, call (737) 222-5294 for reservations TBD per pie. Delicious Breakfast Preview 
Details: Chefs Tyler Johnson and Kyle McKinney are previewing upcoming market/restaurant Delicious' breakfast offerings at Metier. The two will be armed with chorizo kolaches, goat cheese pop tarts, and sweets. Date: Saturday, April 2, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.
